name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: @chazman @esprit_tesla @elonmusk @karpathy This way you can use the "minute elapse events" on the (unsynced) HDMI capture video file to sync very accurately at every 1 minute mark. name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: 7/  ✅ "Economic stimulus" is not a swear word in China. When there's an international crisis, it's common for Chinese economic policy to become extremely accommodative, to catch any temporary shortfall in exports & lower investments due to uncertainty.

name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: 6/  ✅ In China you can take out a corporate loan & can be reasonably certain that even if you perform just on average, you'll be able to pay back the loan. ✅ If you get state loan at low central bank interest rates, you are almost guaranteed to be able to pay back that loan.

name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: 5/  ✅ "Inflation" is not a swear word in China, but a tool used both as 'soft debt forgiveness', and to drive growth & investment. It also keeps internal consumption at bay vs. exports - which gives China its international economic strength.

name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: 4/  ✅ "Debt forgiveness" is not a swear word in China, but an integral part of long-term economic policy. Failed projects get re-financed under new leadership, but debt rarely spreads systematically beyond single troubled actors.

name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: 3/  ✅ There's no friction between the Chinese central bank, government policy teams and government executive teams. When needed, the Chinese central bank will print money, weaken or strengthen their currency, in tight coordination.

name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: @elonmusk @Erdayastronaut @PPathole @vincent13031925 But another important aspect to minimize time to orbit is to maximize propellant density: this reduces rocket cross section and aerodynamic forces: lower "drag losses".  Starship achieves this by using the densest hydrogen storage available at realistic pressures: CH₄.

name: 𝗧𝗲𝘀𝗹𝗮 𝗙𝗮𝗰𝘁𝘀 🔋
tweet: @elonmusk @Erdayastronaut @PPathole @vincent13031925 Put simply, Starship minimizes "time to orbit" with a given mass of propellant & payload, because every second spent not in orbit yet means the rocket is falling back, wasting propellant. ("Gravity losses".)  High S/L TWR is a good first order approximation of that optimization.
